Stages: Stage 2: The "Short Fuse" Technical Challenge (45 Mins)
Stage 3: Pair Programming... with a Detonator (60 Mins)

Logs.Text:
You won't meet a person. You will meet a stack of legal documents.

The Task: Sign 400 pages indemnifying ACME Corp against "accidental flattening," "gravity inversion," and "rapid unscheduled disassembly."

Pass Criteria: You sign without reading.

Logs.Stage: Stage 2: The "Short Fuse" Technical Challenge (45 Mins)
Logs.Text:
The Task: You must debug the timing mechanism. The documentation says it is a 10-second fuse.

The Bug: It is actually a 3-second fuse.

The Test: Can you identify the discrepancy and throw the device out the window before the stack trace (smoke) hits you in the face?

Logs.Stage: Stage 3: Pair Programming... with a Detonator (60 Mins)
Logs.Text:
The Task: You must synchronize the "Rocket Skates" ignition with the "Jet Pack" thrust.

The Twist: The Senior Tester is mute (holding up signs) because he lost his voice screaming during the last sprint. You must interpret his terrified frantic waving correctly to abort the launch.

The Question: "Tell us about a time you failed."

The Correct Answer: You stand up, pull a cord that drops a 1-ton weight on your head, flatten into a disc, and then pop back into 3D shape with a 'poink' sound.

The Feedback: "Excellent recovery time. You're hired."

Description:
The Vibe: High risk, high reward (if you survive).

Responsibilities: Testing the fuse duration on the "Little Giant Firecracker," verifying the aerodynamics of the "Rocket-Powered Roller Skates," and ensuring the "Tornado Kit" actually stops spinning.

Key Requirement: High tolerance for scorch marks, ability to hold up a small umbrella while a boulder falls on you, and excellent health insurance.
Notes: High Blast Tolerance, Rapid Recovery from Flattening...
